page.title: 01Bells Yew Green D-Block
page.content: When I went to Bells Yew Green all I could see was some fields with{crops and some of it was{woodland}and a {small village}with a tiny chapel and post office with a foodshop. Across the road is a pub and further on is Frant Station. It is a peaceful spot. Our area is covered with forests mainly of{deciduous trees,}although there are some conifers. There are also acres of{fields}covering the area. There are lots of woods near it, about twenty of them. In Bells Yew Green there is a{tannery, kennels, {golf course, a cricket ground and a {greenhouse manufacturer.} Bells Yew Green is the{main centre}of activity in the area and has the most housing. Other habitation is mainly individual {farm}houses, tile-hung or weather- boarded with attached{oasts}typical of the district.
